newsitem.title: USA: Timing of IMF Albania mission uncertain - sources.
newsitem.headline: Timing of IMF Albania mission uncertain - sources.

text.p: The timing of a International Monetary Fund mission to Albania, originally scheduled for mid-March, is now uncertain because of the unheaval in the country, monetary sources said Monday.
"It depends on the preparedness of the new government to engage in policy discussions and on the broad security situation," the sources said.
The mission, according to the sources, had planned to discuss current economic conditions with a view of eventually negotiating a specific loan program with the country.
The IMF had approved a $58 million three-year loan program with Albania in July 1993, but Albania was unable to meet the conditions and it went off track in mid-1995.
